sense.name: cut or othewise remove pieces off of
sense.examples: Proserpina had not yet cropped the yellow hair from her head. Crop the image to make it a square, 3x3 inches. The sheep cropped the grass in our lawn. You must crop the ever-budding herb. Some dogs have their tails cropped because people think it looks better.

sense.name: prepare land for or yield crops
sense.examples: This land crops well. My soil will be cropped for potatoes this year.

sense.name: CROP UP/CROP OUT: appear suddenly (at the surface)
sense.examples: Some new reports cropped up so I couldn't come to the party. After they fired the secretary, all sorts of problems cropped up. A vein of ore cropped out.
